Reviews.Title: “Good as you would expect but I've stayed at nicer RC properties”
Reviews.Author: CtHelsBells
Reviews.Content: Good service of course. Corridors & restaurant/bar are freezing though! Nice room and bathroom, old classic style & bath and shower are one. Normally separate in their other hotels but this is an old building. Beautiful building. It's good to be here. Had dinner in 37 which was nice ate at bar as restaurnt was empty. Halibut was excellent would have just liked twice the amount!

Reviews.Title: “Very, very good. VALET is the only problem: $70 a night...”
Reviews.Author: PSMendes
Reviews.Content: Everything about this hotel is top notch. Private concierge on the club lounge is amazing. Please ask for Starsky, very good concierge. The location near Union Square, Chinatown and cable car lines is very convenient. Great dinner recommendations from the concierge. Very restful and satisfying stay. Prefers to stay at 8th floor

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay - Great Location, Beautiful Accommodations, Top Notch Staff!”
Reviews.Author: BlakeTraveler
Reviews.Content: The Ritz-Carlton, San Francisco, located in Nob Hill, was the perfect hotel for my two night business trip. The location is perfect to get around anywhere in the city. Restaurants, bars, and shopping are all within 5-10 minutes walk from the hotel. The rooms are well appointed in standard Ritz-Carlton form and the lobby, bar, and other common areas are up to date but not too over the top. The service is top notch, from the front door staff in the motor lobby to the warm front desk staff eagerly waiting to take care of you. I was upgraded to a very large room with a nice view of the city. I'm a Platinum member with Ritz-Carlton, which includes free wireless internet and a room upgrade upon availability. I didn't have time to actually dine or drink at the restaurant and lobby bar, but they were both busy every night. This property is not your standard high rise Ritz-Carlton. It's a former insurance headquarters built many years ago. It blends right into the San Francisco architecture and has a boutique feel, though it's a fairly large property. Also, cabs are easy to get during the busy mornings. Great stay all around absolutely worth the price. Highly recommend for business or pleasure!

Reviews.Title: “Comfort at Luxury's Best”
Reviews.Author: FishyNyc
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at The Ritz in San Francisco and had a great experience at this location. The Staff was so welcoming, hospitable and helpful especially in giving us information leisure activities around the city. Our room was very spacious and the bed was super comfortable and great for a good nights sleep. The gym facility was very large and had a very good amount of cardie machines and also had a good weight lifting area. The hotel did some small extra touches like complimentary coffee in the morning, lemonade and cucumber water in the afternoon, and fun fortune cookies during the day/night. The location of this hotel is great and near a lot of good restaurants and close to union square. When we return we will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: Karen B
Reviews.Content: I'm here on business with my husband, staying on the 8th floor, which is the club level. The food and drink available here are phenomenal and all included with your room rate. Having happy hour every night with our friends and coworkers has been fabulous too!

Reviews.AuthorLocation: City of Big Bear Lake, California
Reviews.Title: “Quality Guest Service”
Reviews.Author: Desiree P
Reviews.Content: Offers a comfortable and conservative feeling with an exceptional staff for every request (we checked in at midnight and they opened the gift store so we could get headache medicine). We were luckily were upgraded to an awesome view room from a small room that was located on the street side (which would have really sucked, especially for the $400/night rate). The corner room was beautiful with a center courtyard and bridge view. There is an indoor pool which is a plus for soaking sore feet from walking the city. It is a few blocks walk (hilly) to any coffee shops, restaurants, etc. Located in Nob Hill area, close to Chinatown. Not for the trendy, nor hip vibe like the at the Clift.

Reviews.Title: “Just Ritz!”
Reviews.Author: ameeral
Reviews.Content: After a little research for rooming in the San Francisco bay area I opted to go Ritz . No surprises . It's just Ritzy! Another great vacation . Keeping it Ritz all the way . Looking forward to my next Ritz destination ? Dubai for my birthday

Reviews.Title: “Noisy room only turnoff”
Reviews.Author: Wymlae
Reviews.Content: Cannot fault anything on service, amenities etc but slept very badly as a result of street noise (rubbish trucks, loud drunks etc.): avoid a room on road!

Reviews.Title: “Impeccable service, but LOUD hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jtraveler44
Reviews.Content: The Ritz in San Fransico is over the top beautiful from the outside and your are immediately greeted by wonderful staff who are on top of their game. The staff does a wonderful job of making you feel welcome and accommodated. The lobby is beautiful, the rooms are traditional and very clean. However the hotel definitely needs some updates the shower has low flow and doesn't get very hot. The biggest problem my husband and I had was the noise level. You can hear everything going on in the halls, every door shut, the room service vacuums cleaning, conversations in the hallways. So if you like to sleep in or if you are a light sleeper I would not recommend this hotel for you. We really enjoyed the staff and the location really can't be beat but we couldn't sleep so we would have to pass on this hotel next time we go to San Fransico.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel! Staff couldn't be better.”
Reviews.Author: st92
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a week at the end of February. Our rooms were beautiful and clean. The staff was outstanding and the club level was one of the best. The staff in this hotel could not have been more accommodating. We all were made to feel as though we were the only ones staying here. I can't wait to return. The location is convienent to all. It's right near China town and a cable car stop.

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon Heaven”
Reviews.Author: alexgwatts
Reviews.Content: Fantastic Hotel - they could not do enough for us. We visited it on our Honeymoon and the reservations staff were very accommodating, arranging our wedding song to be playing on the CD when we first went into the room, they arranged the flowers we had as well and there were hand made chocolates and champagne. This was all exactly as I requested and we very professionally done. The hotel itself was elegant calm and sophisticated but we felt just as at home in shorts and flip flops as we did in a suit (required for dinner in the Dining Room) I would go back tomorrow if I had the cash! Excellent - cannot enthuse enough! (We visited in 2004 - not 2011 as shown below)

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: marlene616
Reviews.Content: This is a hotel you should not wait to visit. It's a wonderful hotel for families, and couples. Great service, good food, and wonderful rooms. Its a delight to stay here. It's not far from all of San Francisco, and gives you a chance to really see the city. The Valet and all of the front desk really care and are very helpful. The decor is classic, and very well done. I understand they are re-modeling soon, so we will see.

Reviews.Title: “Classic hotel and nice staff”
Reviews.Author: cstocker
Reviews.Content: I was intown for work and stayed at the Ritz Carlton because of the good rate I got. The doormen were very pleasant which is nice because that's your first intro to the hotel. The front desk staff were also pleasant and checked me in quickly. The decor in the lobby is very modern but my room's decor more old classic. My room was on the 5th floor and far away from the elevator. It was a spacious room with a king bed. The bathroom was roomy with a separate area with the toilet. Room service and housekeeper were top notch.

Reviews.Title: “Great, Good & Needs Improvement”
Reviews.Author: Bring_earplugs
Reviews.Content: What sets this hotel apart for me is the service and employees, they are just great, and they really do care. We had an extended stay, and the staff at the Club Level made us feel like we were at home. Every year we come back, we hope that things have not changed and that we can expect the same service and people, and that was the case yet again. Great: The Club Level is really outstanding, better than any other Ritz we have stayed at. The food is excellent and, as mentioned, the service is amazing. I really enjoy the atmosphere, where it is not done in some overly modern fashion that removes any warmth, as say the LA Live Ritz. Also, after trying Parallel 37, the food is great, and the remodel is well done. Good: Well, it really is only passable, and that is the room service menu, not what you would call good food. The menu is not creative at all, basic Marriott style, and the quality is sub par. Because we have a small child, we ate off this menu more than a few times, and I just could not understand how the food could not measure up, when the Club food is great, and so is the restaurant food. Needs Improvement: Hmm, they call it a Spa? I guess you should wonder when there are no pictures of it on the web site, that is a tip that there really is no spa. I was sitting in a dingy hallway, in my robe, ready for a treatment, and people were coming and going, as there was no lounge area. The treatment room was right there, accessed from the hallway, and you got to see who used the room right before you, the clean up, and then also the nice couple that was going to use it when I got out, they looked surprised to see me coming out. Okay, couple this with the smelly locker room, showers that are so hot that you can't use them (no cold water at all) and the cigarette butt that was on the carpet floor below my locker and you get the general idea. Yes, that did happen. I hate to be negative about this, but how can it be great hotel, and advertize a spa, with these facilities, or lack there of? The management was very attentive and did credit me for the treatment when I noted the deficiencies, which was nice. Transition to the final bill review upon check out, and my bill was not correct. They charged for Valet, which was included, and I also had a 3 night package, two back to back, and that was not correct, as they billed the entire amount. When I noted this, they fixed it, but then only credited back the cheapest night, not the package rate, so it had to be done again. I thought this part was really not acceptable, The guest should not be required to find large billing errors, or risk overpayment. As noted, the rooms are a bit worn and dated, but hopefully they will be updated soon. Great hotel, and the service overrides the other issues.

Reviews.Title: “Ritz service but dated property”
Reviews.Author: davis121
Reviews.Content: The Hotel: As with most of SF there is limited space and although Ritz Carlton does a good job with the lobby and other areas, it just feels it needs a renovation. I may be biased beacuse I usually dont stay in SF and not used to the small size hotels. The service is typical Ritz and I say that in a good way. My one complaint would be the doormen didnt make me feel invited and seem to spend most of their time with someone who may give them a large tip. The Room: Small.....They do the best they can with the space they have but as mentioned before a renovation is in order and I fully understand the cost and logistics to keep the hotel open during renovation is a nightmare. We just returned from Rosewood Hotel Georgia in Vancouver and they also have limited space but Ritz should use them as an example. Fitness: No pool and there is a large area for yoga and stretching but again the same theme of being small with limited equipement. Spa: Didnt use it but the area always smells nice and the staff working the area was very nice. Tea and coffee is available near the spa. Restaurant: We ate there twice for breakfast and it was very good. Our waiter on the first day was very nice and catered to our daughter and our friends kids very well. My wife had the buffett and she liked it but maybe a bit overpriced but the quality was definetely good. The kids french toast covered with cereal was a hit with the kids. The second day breakfst was a Tuesday and our waited looked like he was in training. Not as a fun an experience as the first( i wish I could remember his name to give him credit). Location: Good and correct from other reviews of being close to Chinatown and Union Square. Just a 5 min walk to either place. The trolley also around the corner from the hotel. Didnt have a car so cant comment on parking but Im sure it is very difficult.

Reviews.Title: “Simple Yet Sophisticated”
Reviews.Author: seanmichaelbarb
Reviews.Content: Just from walking in the front door of the lobby, I knew that this was going to be a spectacular stay. After traveling all the way across the country from my college on the east coast to surprise my parents for my mom's 50th birthday, I was extremely tired and wanted to take a nap. The staff was extremely accommodating, gave me a room key and didn't bother me while a slept during the afternoon waiting for my mom to arrive back from the napa valley to surprise her. I loved the décor of the lobby - to summarize it, it's simple yet sophisticated. Elegant yet I didn't find it pretentious. The view from the room was AMAZING, we could easily see out to alcatraz. I could have stared out the window all day long. On the top floor with club level access which I HIGHLY recommend - excellent food and really amazing service. I have absolutely no idea how someone could COMPLAIN about the service at this hotel - It makes me sick that someone could actually take themselves that seriously. Just because you can afford to stay at the Ritz doesn't mean you're entitled to a pedestal They are not overbearing at all, they're only helpful. These people bend over backwards for you. I have stayed at many many hotels all over North America and the world and let me make something clear, above all the service at this hotel was possibly the best I've ever seen. Period. The room was really nice (junior executive club level suite) - to be honest, a little tired but they are all being renovated in the near future from what I hear. Room service menu was EH but REALLY with so many amazing restaurants in the area it's a shame to be ordering room service. Restaurant in lobby is truly exquisite great breakfast - VERY EXPENSIVE. I've stayed at multiple Ritz-Cartlon's and this hotel is no exception to their gold standard. I sincerely am appalled at any negative feedback for this hotel besides the rooms which could use an update. The employees are fantastic. Would absolutely stay here again - you get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: “Still love the Ritz SF”
Reviews.Author: Gracefultraveler
Reviews.Content: After reading recent reviews I was a bit nervous coming back for our yearly trip to the Ritz in San Francisco. However our experience was just as wonderful as it has been for the last five years. Although we were sad to see the Dining Room close, the new restaurant - Parallel 37 has the same talented chef, serving fresh, inventive dishes. The ambiance was casual enough to dine early with our well behaved 3 year old and the staff are polite and knowledgeable. I found the lobby renovations to be well done. A great designer had their hand at keeping the space elegant and modern, without feeling cold and uninviting. The staff throughout this hotel are always delightful. They are seasoned and mature. The club level food is still fantastic. The club staff is attentive and have always made us feel at home during our week plus stay. There are two disappointing aspects of this hotel. First the rooms service menu is a joke. There are few options and the food is just not very good, at prices that make you want to gag. Secondly the spa is not a spa. They advertise spa services and claim that the spa has been renovated. In fact the only thing they have done is remove the pool and make the fitness area larger. One entire room is full of dirty yoga mats, a floor that was never replaced and looks like a cheap dirty gym, not a spa There is no appropriate waiting area for spa services, nothing that makes you feel like you are actually in a spa at all. It needs a redo desperately. The rooms will be updated next year, which they are ready for. I just hope they do a better job on the rooms than they did on the supposed "spa renovation." We love this hotel and will keep coming back for the staff, the club, the food and location.

Reviews.Title: “Quite Impressive”
Reviews.Author: jacca83
Reviews.Content: I'd like to start off by saying that I've had the pleasure of staying in various Ritz Carlton properties throughout the United States. While being pleased with just about every stay I must say that my stay at Ritz Carlton, San Francisco definitely provided the WOW factor. The staff is extremely Professional, Polite and Accommodating. It all started at check in when they offered a welcome glass of champagne. It may not have be Cristal but was a nice gesture to welcome incoming guests. Every Ritz Carlton should do this. Check in was a breeze and the agent was friendly and expeditious and I was in my room in less than 5 minutes. I was in a Club Deluxe room. From what I noticed the Superior/Deluxe rooms are not tremendous but not small either but more importantly well maintained. The bathroom is a very important factor for me when I rate a hotel. Since it is a older building, the standard rooms did have a shower/tub combo and I do prefer separates but, what I did notice was the marble was actually in very good condition and shiny. Lots of hotels have marble bathrooms and never maintain or polish the marble and it ends up looking old, spotted and dirty (Ritz Carlton Marina del Rey) but not at RC SFO. The marble was clean and shiny. as were all marble areas throughout the hotel. In addition, the Club lounge definitely seemed superior to other RC Club lounges. Their offerings were extensive, offerings were nearly continuous, so there were no long gaps of in between times and every single club concierge could not bend over backwards enough to be more accommodating. I spent most of my stay in the club lounge and noticed that the Ladies & Gentlemen truly take pride in their jobs/hotel and understand the philosophy of Ritz Carlton. I took a loot at the gym and it looked like there were ample machines/weights. The SPA was a little odd shaped and the layout may not be of a typical SP but nonetheless seemed acceptable. Hotel is pricey but you get what you pay for. What a luxurious and serious orientated stay? Stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Going Downhill Faster than a Cable Car”
Reviews.Author: RTL212
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this particular Ritz Carlton over a dozen times, but hadn't been there in about 7 years. I have anew business matter that will take me to San Francisco every month or so for the next year so was looking forward to staying at the Ritz again. I stayed there last month and was shocked (I hadn't realized that Marriott bought them and don't know if that is the reason for the changes). When I arrived I was stunned -- they'd just completed a major "renovation" of the bar, the restaurant and the main lounge off the entry area. The "new" areas are dreadful -- the main lounge area was a shock -- it's a bizarre mix of disharmonious colors and furniture design that can't be explained. I guess the closest description would be "Clockwork Orange come to the Ritz." The bar has a red light glow, the walls are dark charcoal, the chairs look like they were plucked from a Disney ride, the fabrics are in a visual war with each other, and for people who like comfort when they relax for a couple of hours with some friends over drinks, if you like your chairs at rigid 90 degree angles that leave you with back pain, you'll love it. I can't imagine an uglier room, and we spent some time retrying to conceive of a contemporary design concept that could explain what they did. We failed -- no design concept was apparent. The new restaurant lives up to the maxim: if it ain't broke, don't fix it. The closest visual analogy I could think of was one of those all-you-can-east buffet rooms in a glitzy Las Vegas Hotel. And the old bar, with its comfortable cozy chairs and warm colors has been replaced by something resembling a waiting room in one of those airport club lounges, only most of the latter are more inviting. For perspective, I am not a big fan of the Ritz Carlton's more classic look of repro American furniture, so it's not as if they replaced something I loved. But this particular Ritz, with its admirable location and nice scale, was a good place, and now its awful. I used to spend hours meeting friends and clients in the discreet old bar and the lounge. During my 5 days I didn't spend a minute -- well, one exception, when I went to the bar adjacent the restaurant for a bar snack, I couldn't find a single thing on the menu that I wanted, and I'll usually go for anything. Another defect? The room haven't been touched. Yes, they're clean, but they are very dated and boring. What was nice 10-20 years ago is just plain dull. And the one thing I always intensely disliked at the Ritz -- well, they've kept that -- the staff is intrusive, indiscreet and sometimes just plain aggressive. Somehow, the Ritz is able to find perfectly nice and motivated staff and train them to intrude on the clientele at every opportunity. When you come down in the morning on your way to the entrance to find a taxi, you run a gauntlet of insincerely, robotically programmed staff yelling out your name -- I don't need 6 "good morning Mr. X" greetings when I walk 30 yards to the entrance. Whenever I stayed at the Ritz, if it was for a business deal that needed to be kept discreet, I always had my clients check in with fake names to avoid having their names shouted for every passing journalist to hear and leak to the Wall Street Journal. In short, a good hotel has been ruined. I've booked the Four Seasons for my next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel ever!”
Reviews.Author: Marina A
Reviews.Content: If I could give them 6 stars it would be more appropriate. The place was just renovated and is gorgeous and the service is unmatched . We stayed 2 nights because we split our trip bw San Fran and Napa. That was a mistake. We should have just stayed there for our entire trip. The first night we had the most delicious chocolate covered strawberries waiting for us in our room. The second night that we checked in they upgraded us to the Club level. OMG! So amazing! All because they knew we were there to celebrate my husbands 40th. The staff is so well trained and customer focused we felt like royalty. I will only stay at the Ritz from now on. Best money we spent our entire trip! They even drove us to the Pier in the hotels Lexus so we wouldn't miss our ferry for an excursion that they booked for us!

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional value for perfect service and accommodation”
Reviews.Author: BarryAscot
Reviews.Content: We stayed in December in two suites, as we are a family of five, including three children. The location is really good, with the old street-cars nearby. The main restaurant food was terrific as was the service. Our suites were lovely as was the club lounge. We usually stay in the Ritz Carlton Central Park NYC where the service is even better, however I would still give this hotel a top rating.

Reviews.Title: “putting on the ritz”
Reviews.Author: micheelg
Reviews.Content: club level ritz carlton, is an excellent choice for a special occasion, very comfortable beds and good size room.

Reviews.Title: “Exudes a calm and classy ambiance”
Reviews.Author: mojo2012oovajay
Reviews.Content: I spent two nights as part of a financial conference and was continuously impressed by the high level of service, and overall serenity that this very well run property exudes. It is walking distance (for those who can handle the steep SF hills) from Union Square and the plethora of restaurants that surround it. Obviously not inexpensive, but the quality of the room, the service, the food, etc. justify the cost.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding”
Reviews.Author: dnys1
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a club level room at this Ritz for a getaway weekend, and we were consistently impressed with the quality of service and the consistency of the staff. The club level offers an outstanding all day food service that really allows you to be flexible with your other plans and reservations. While the external facade of the Ritz makes you wonder if they originally planned on locating in Las Vegas, the internal features and services are first class. Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel but not outstanding”
Reviews.Author: Jason H
Reviews.Content: As a premium 5-star hotel they advertise being exceptional. The hotel itself is beautiful, clean and well serviced. The rooms are no better than many other 4+ star hotels we have stayed in for less cost. The concierge was excellent with suggestions for places to eat and see and arranged reservations well. The only real issue was the feeling of being suffocated at times by the staff. Every time you walk in the door "Oh, Welcome Back is there anything we can help you with" by 2-3 different people and when you are in and out a few times a day we felt a little bit like we were being hounded. Overall a very nice stay in a great city.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectionsits.”
Reviews.Author: GeorgeLaszlo
Reviews.Content: The people of this hotel are really great! The location of course is super, the rooms are perfect, but what makes this hotel (chain to my experience) special is the people. HR must do a great job in selecting and training staff.

Reviews.Title: “The Shining Hotel on The Hill”
Reviews.Author: JBHAtlanta
Reviews.Content: This Ritz Carlton is probably one of my favorites because of the attentive staff and the impeccable way they maintain the rooms and the common areas. I rarely see a hotel with such high marks in that area. The other Ritz that gets the same high marks in this area is the Dallas location. Housekeeping at both of these properties must have a secret that should be shared with all hotels. The San Francisco Ritz is located within a short walk of shopping and wonderful restaurants although after a long day of shopping you might want to opt for a cab back to the hotel is walking is an issue for you as the Ritz is atop a hill with a long approach that can be tough if you're tired. Both the Ritz and the Fairmont are at the top of a big hill so there is no escaping this if you want to stay at the better hotels. The beds at the hotel are so comfortable that you will have a tough time getting going in the morning. There truly won't be one thing that the staff neglects as far as wants and needs. I stay on Club Level and this Club is possibly one of the largest in the Ritz chain. There are normally 3 Concierge at the Club desk so waiting is never an issue. The food service is top notch and the view from the Club is fabulous. They will make a special occasion unforgettable if you make them aware of what you are celebrating. So whether you are in SF for business, a college visit, a shopping trip, or to visit the wine country, ask the staff for direction and they will make sure you have a trip that you will never forget!

Reviews.Title: “Very good....however, not great for 5 star property”
Reviews.Author: SF94597
Reviews.Content: Ritz Carlton properties are always of high quality -- which is what you expect of 5 star hotels at this price point. The hotel is quite nice - rooms are large & comfortable. The in-room coffee service is higher quality than most & I always appreciate when evening turndown service includes bottled water. The bathroom is ok, not great. Surprisingly, the comfortable chairs have no lighting so need to rely on light on bedside table or natural light during day (yes, I know this is a nitpick). In room safe is small. Hotel service is, as expected, very good. Staff is helpful and accomodating - & a lot of staff available to help. Gym is nice sized & well equipped. Being in Nob Hill - if choosing location for proximity to local sites, need to be aware of the hills. On the positive side, walking to/from the local attractions provides an opportunity to elevate the heart rate & burn off a few extra calories.

Reviews.Title: “Standard Ritz stay: great location, nice hotel, polished service”
Reviews.Author: nreitter
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Ritz SF for 3 nights for business. It was everything I'd anticipated: great location (smack dab in between Union Square & Chinatown - a 5-minute walk to either; but beware, the Ritz is on a big hill, if you have issues with some climbing); well-appointed rooms (king bed, sumptuous duvet & linens, marble in the bathroom); exceptional service. The service could've been a bit over-the-top (2 people walked me to my room, every time I stepped out of my room it seemed someone stepped in to tidy it up) but I took it with a grain of salt & knew this is signature-Ritz. A few small complaints: 1- my shower would NOT get hot; was always luke-warm (room 458). It was raining a ton while I was there & at the end of a long day I wanted a hot shower to warm up but it didn't happen. 2- $64 for overnight parking-- that's ridiculous when the garage (St. Mary's) just down on Pine St. is $32. 3- when I got a blister from walking they charged me $2.14 when I requested a Band-Aid. Other than these little quirks, I'd stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Em-Atlanta
Reviews.Content: Service was fantastic, location was great and value was great. Very nice hotel but it needs a renovation in the near future. The rooms are good but not great. The shower was OK. The lobby is really nice. I would stay there again for sure. But when I think Ritz-Carlton I think "creme de la creme" and this didnt quite meet my expectations. Also they charge for wi-fi. But the gym is really great! And the staff was helpful. It rained the whole time and there were ample umbrellas for guests to use.

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: CarolinePLondon
Reviews.Content: I stayed here and at the Mandarin in SF and this wins hands down. Better service, friendlier staff and a real feeling of old world luxury. I would definately go back.

Reviews.Title: “Ritz Carlton service chain wide - particularly sf , ca continues to deteriorate along with management credibility.”
Reviews.Author: colorblind123
Reviews.Content: Management has this hotel has zero credibility and service levels are embarrassingly low: examples: First of all I was in a club level suite and paying roughly $750.00 usd per night. To boot over the past decade I have stayed at this location 20 plus times. Examples of laughable service and zero credibility: 1) club level is supposed to mean superior service and a dedicated club level concierge. I asked for a bit of advice regarding some suggestions on what would be timely to do with the kids. They did not bother to get Back with me , though they promised to. 2) my car was parked by the valet service. Two days later , I had my car pulled up and I noticed substantial damage to the left rear of the car. I asked the valet about it. He assured me they would have a look at the video and call me right away. Well they did not call me. I had to call them after a long wait. No sense of urgency by staff . Anyway - the first verbal report I was given was that they could not tell if car was already damaged. The next day I asked and they said they could sort of see the damage when I originally pulled in, but they could not really tell. I asked to view the tape . They said sure, but then refused to let me view the tape. The following day, a third person called me a d said they could see it , but with glare. The whole thing was ridiculous. In fact it got more absurd . The day of my departure , the manager proposed to credit the parking fee. I was like , sadly management is not kidding. I could not care less about a parking credit. I only wanted the damaged car addressed if in fact my car was undamaged when I checked in . Incidentally - management lasted provided a photo of the damage as proof. However , the photo they sent me as proof - was the photo the valet took once I reported the damage. The reason I know that was bc the valets reflection and my own reflection showed up in the picture. 3) pretty funny to top it off. That parking credit they said was issued, never was. T

Reviews.Title: “Tired and uncaring staff”
Reviews.Author: Jenni2012
Reviews.Content: Have fond memories of staying here about 5 years ago, but upon my return I was thoroughly disappointed. The staff are uncaring and seem to do the bare minimum required (nothing is more frustrating when receptionists/concierges interrupt your conversation with them to answer the phone- or speak to another member of staff) We stayed on the Exec floor and as a family were offered 2 rooms on different floors- we weren't escorted to the rooms, or explained anything about the hotel, which is strange considering we were there for leisure for a few nights and weren't regular guests. There are definitely other better places to stay nearby for better value.

Reviews.Title: “Great service but outdated decor and rooms”
Reviews.Author: Tkyrnr
Reviews.Content: The service at the Ritz Carlton is great. From the moment you get out of the taxi through check in, everyone is friendly and welcoming. The check process was very fast and I was in my room quickly. Every employee of the hotel greets you as you walk by. I especially liked it when several welcomed me back after I went for a run. Small touches make a big impression. My room was fairly large and was clean and well maintained. The decor does seem a little dated and the bathroom small for a hotel in this category. The bed was excellent. My primary complaint about the room was with the weak wifi reception in the room. The hotel seems to be updating the decor in the lobby and restaurants. I didn't try the new restaurant on the lobby level, but the decor seems more in line with the newer Ritz's.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Service - Amazing Staff”
Reviews.Author: newyorkdoll4
Reviews.Content: Stayed over Christmas for one week with my husband and children. The service was excellent. Every staff member was courteous and helpful. Stayed on the club level. Food presentations were lovely. The hotel itself is stately and sedate as opposed to trendy or cutting edge. We enjoyed the hotel's location with its easy access to Chinatown as well as Union Square. A cable car stops right outside the hotel. Have stayed in many Ritz -Carltons over the years and this one has one of the best club levels I have had the pleasure to stay on.

Reviews.Title: “Christmas 2011”
Reviews.Author: BB6262
Reviews.Content: This is our second time we have chosen to stay at the Ritz in San Francisco. You must get a room on the club level. The club lounge is fully stocked with breakfast, lunch, light dinner and desserts. There is plenty of wine and spirits in the evening, complimentary. The club manager, Joseph, is very friendly and sees to all your needs. The rooms are spacious and very clean with Bvlgari amenities. You are close to Union Square, the cable car and restaurants. You are greeted at the entrance by the very friendly doorman. As you enter the spacious lobby, fully decorated for Christmas, everyone greets you with a smile and calls you by name. The architecture is "old S.F." with a modern flair. We had a great three nights and will go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Service, Service, Service”
Reviews.Author: travelerguy23
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Ritz last week for business. The hotel is in a great old marble building a couple blocks from Union Square. The room was very nice, flat screen TV, nice desk. Decor was nice, but a little old-school, not a sleek fashionable SF option if you are looking for edgy or cool. The service was really what stood out. They had a ton of staff wherever you turned. They were polite, helpful and friendly. One of the better hotel service experiences I have had, even at this level of hotel chain.

Reviews.Title: “Downtown and Service”
Reviews.Author: TopDoc2010
Reviews.Content: Great location. Steps from Chinatown, Union Square and the Ritz service. great fitness center to exercise and relax. Reasonable prices given the Ritz

Reviews.Title: “Love the personal attention.”
Reviews.Author: Sandradot
Reviews.Content: Had a nice weekend getaway, The concierge was very helpful and booked some great dinner reservations (ChaChaCha in the Haight and House-asian fusion). Valet parking is expensive but then every hotel in SF is high. The service is why we love the Ritz Carlton. Lobby and rooms are elegant and location is central to shopping and sightseeing. Bathrooms are luxurious and what you expect from the Ritz.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful San francisco weekend”
Reviews.Author: Plumesie
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went in for a weekend to celebrate our birthdays early December. We couldn't have picked a better place than the Ritz! As we checked in we were offered a glass of champagne, as we sat down in the lobby bar, snacks were immediately offered, then we got to our room and it turned out to be this marvelous suite, lovely rooms and bathroom facilities. The bed linens and pillows were such that you hardly wanted to get up in the morning, even so we managed to get downstairs to the restaurant to have breakfast. I can't say enough about the friendly, professional demeanor of all the staff and the lovely holiday decorations in the hotel that made it all such a wonderful experience! It is highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience!”
Reviews.Author: firstreview931
Reviews.Content: So we usually don't write reviews, but need to once in a while. The experience we had at the Ritz SF was great and we enjoyed the short stay here prior to Thanksgiving. The check-in was very nice and requests were honored. The bellman was wonderful and helped move to a room with a bathtub.....he went donwstairs and did all of the work to switch rooms. Both rooms were clean and very nice. Even though the hotel is a little older, it has old world charm with class. Then housekeeping knocked on the door and extended gifts to our daughter. It is always a nice gesture at Ritz Hotels to give books and bath toys to the kids! When the kids are happy then the parents have a much better retreat. While in the hallways, employees were always polite and sincerely sweet. Overall, the service was amazing from check-in to check-out. One small tip.....wish the club level servers were as attentive as the Ritz Central Park New York. We are always offered a beverage upon walking through the door in NY and it makes me want to return as soon as possible. But when we asked for something in the SF Club, we were treated with courtesy. We will be back soon.....

Reviews.Title: “About what you’d expect”
Reviews.Author: gwera
Reviews.Content: We had a courteous check-in. The hotel has a great location. The furnishings and carpet were showing their age. We got room service pizza for a snack one night and found it average for a nice hotel meal. The in room red wine at the minibar was excellent for the money (Ritz House Brand). We watched a movie one evening and the streaming video was choppy. Our room did not include Bulgari soaps as at other properties. Overall about what you’d expect for a luxury hotel in beautiful SF. There were no pleasant surprises or disappointments.

Reviews.Title: “Old World Charms...but rooms need to be updated”
Reviews.Author: NorCalBusTrav
Reviews.Content: Staff, service and location are why you come to the Ritz in SF. The rooms are clean and comfortable, just need to be updated in this competitive market yes, it's expensive, but don't be shocked or complain, as you knew it when you picked the place. Top notch staff will keep you coming back.

Reviews.Title: “Interesting Experience”
Reviews.Author: charlesweintz87
Reviews.Content: This was our first visit to any Ritz-Carlton property. It made for an interesting experience. The staff was wonderful. They all were very pleasant to work with and were happy to oblige any need. The concierge service was very helpful and made dinner reservations for us in short notice to a very nice restaurant in the city. Our junior suite was very nice but lacked a view that I was hoping for. We also had Club level privleges and that was nice. They have finger-foods and drinks all day and into the evening. Overall, very nice property. It is quite formal in all areas. If you want a place to just hang out: this isn't it. Be prepared to play the part or at least witness the elite-class of people and all that comes with it. (yes, some of them had attitudes. {some of the other guests not the staff})

Reviews.Title: “Huge rooms in Grand luxury”
Reviews.Author: Trilife
Reviews.Content: The hotel is old luxury, updated with all the modern amenities. EXTREMELY attentive staff. They seem to outnumber guests 3 to 1. The location on the hill is not for everyone I suppose, but it makes for a great view and it is still relatively central.

Reviews.Title: “Great Facilities and Great Service”
Reviews.Author: jaharts
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Ritz in San Francisco and was extremely pleased. The rooms were large and nice. The hotel provided all the extras expected from the Ritz. Of course, it was the service that made the difference. I was taking the red eye back to the east coast and the staff allowed me to return to the hotel in evening after checking out to use the gym and take a shower. This made my trip much more enjoyable since I didn't have to sit at the airport all night.

Reviews.Title: “Best Ritz so far!”
Reviews.Author: str82th
Reviews.Content: My wife and I returned to SF for our 20th anniversary. We had to upgrade because there were no standard rooms available and I was a little concerned about $909/night but it was worth every penny. We have probably stayed at about 7 different Ritz-Carlton hotels and this was the best yet. The room was absolutely beautifully appointed with comfortable and beautiful furniture in the suite. The bedroom was beautiful. The two bathrooms were just as nice and very comfortable. The shower had great pressure (a "pet peeve" of mine). We had everything we could want. The breakfast was included in a private dining area for guests on the top two floors. It was top notch with delicious fruit, great coffee choices, fresh fish and wonderful pastries. The staff was great. We needed help with directions, things to do and restaurants and they were right on the money with all three. Check-in was easy and took all of two minutes. They offered water bottles and a fresh towel at check-in which were nice touches. The location is pretty good but may have been better if a little closer to the bay but it was very close to Chinatown so its really just about what you want to see. We did walk almost everywhere and only needed a ride to one restaurant which they had their limo. take us to without hesitation. Overall, we thought this was a great hotel in almost all ways possible. Sorry to see there are some negative reviews but our room, at least, was up-to-date and gorgeous.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious rooms but not the best views.”
Reviews.Author: AndreaPeek
Reviews.Content: Lovely amenities and walking distance to downtown highlights. Not impressed with views for the price.

Reviews.Title: “The Ritz never lets us down!”
Reviews.Author: betsyscott
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful Ritz series hotel. The lighting and views make for a majestic experience in the heart of such an alive city!! Staff at the Ritz is always impeccable and they live by what they say -- "Ladies and Gentlemen serving Ladies and Gentlemen". I always know it will be a great vacation when we choose the Ritz (so clean, great service, generous space, beautiful views) so my family was very excited to find this location just as perfect as all of the others. Thank you Ritz SF. Highly recommended, fellow travelers!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, but Spa disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Paul M
Reviews.Content: You know you are in for great service when the doorman remembers your name! Concierge level on 8th floor is one of the best places to relax and the excellent food is included. Tried 3 hotels during our stay and Ritz had by far the best beds. Spa...hmmm not really and what was provided was disappointing. option is the hike three blocks up the hill on California and enjoy the Nob Hill Spa.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Complimentary Upgrade”
Reviews.Author: agass
Reviews.Content: The Ritz sits atop of Nob Hill just a short walk from China Town and North Beach. Pier 39 and Fisherman's Wharf are a bit further but definitely walkable. Upon checking-in I was given a complimentary upgrade to a Jr. Suite on the 7th floor facing the front of the hotel. The suite was very nice with a bar area, a sitting area, an office area, a sleeping area and two windows - it was the size of many smaller apartments in the city. The bathroom had marble floors and countertops and a tub / shower combo with a curtain. I expect to see a glass shower enclosure in this type of hotel but it didn't ruin my stay. The only real negative during my stay was the water pressure in the toilet and the fact that during one of my showers, the water turned cold. The hotel grounds were new and well maintained and the staff was friendly. I had the opportunity to enjoy several hotel provided meals during my stay: they were all excellent. The bar was nice with good service and the drinks were quality. Overall, my stay was excellent -- I would recommend the Ritz SF to my family and friends.

Reviews.Title: “The Ritz never disappoints!!”
Reviews.Author: BMG60
Reviews.Content: We had a lovely larger room--very spacious, most comfortable bed with double sinks in bath and walk in closet. Almost didn't want to leave the room! As always, the staff was very professional, pleasant and helpful. The dining room is closed for renovations, but we had a couple of lovely meals in the terrace restaurant just off the lobby. a good thing to know--if you get a Hertz rental car, you can have it delivered to the Ritz and drop it off there when you are done.

Reviews.Title: “WOAW WHAT A HOTEL WHAT A SERVICE ! PERFECT”
Reviews.Author: Selcukdegerli
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel.... location is great..service is perfect...... Rooms are great.. The club lounge service is very good and proffessional. what else I can say..... The General Manager Mr. Raul Salcido has done a great job at the hotel...congratulations... whoemever wants to go SF must stay at the Ritz Carlton San Francısco

Reviews.Title: “Wasn't a "Ritz" experience”
Reviews.Author: bigsur221
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently completed our first stay at the Ritz Carlton, San Francisco. I will start by saying I had relatively expectations of the hotel after staying at a number of Marriott and Ritz hotels, and also reading the reviews. Our experience unfortunately was not of the same caliber other guests have written about. I will start by saying this is a beautifully restored property in a desirable location (top of hill), near shopping, Chinatown, etc. The issues: • Hotel rooms need refreshing. Wallpaper is starting to curl. Carpets stained. Just not what I would expect at a Ritz. • No Bulgari bath products, relatively small bathroom (one vanity). Reminded me of a more traditional Marriott room • Construction noise. The weekend we stayed they were doing a significant renovation on the dining room. This not only impacted the lobby area, but unfortunately the room (and nearby rooms) above that area. This was not relayed to us upon making the reservation, nor was it mentioned upon check-in. The jackhammers started before 9am on a Sunday. • Customer service at front desk was clearly not what we expected. Maybe we just hit hotel on the wrong weekend, but a hotel of this caliber should always have good service. • Called several times to get an answer. Also, when I went to front desk to get a copy of the bill at check-out, I noted another guest discussing how loud his room was. Apparently on the courtyard, and had a lot of noise from activities taking place. He had asked the person at the desk for a change in room, but appeared to be rudely cut off by the individual, stating that the rooms on the street side are actually much noisier. They went back and forth arguing until the guest said just to change the room and walked away. This was concerning as I had never seen a member of the Ritz staff treat a guest in this fashion (essentially telling them to be quiet so they could get their point across). • Valet- took over a half hour for them to pull car around, after calling. There was no one waiting in front of us and it was the middle of the day.

Reviews.Title: “The ritz carlton san francisco”
Reviews.Author: debralynn2010
Reviews.Content: Very historic property! Everyone is very helpful. We opted for the cablecar/bus pass for the week we were there. It is definitely at the top of the hill so cab money helps at night. We stayed on the club level and the service was spot on. They were so helpful with maps and car rental. They do try to steer you to really upscale restaurants and there are a lot of local places that are just as good. We tried Rocco's Cafe, it was on diners, drive-ins & dives and the Chicken Piccata, perfect. The only drawback.... No hot tub / No pool and after walking all day, our entire party could have used one. Never been to a Ritz with no pool?

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: AdmRep
Reviews.Content: My daughters and I spent 5 nights at The Ritz Carlton San Francisco. It is located in a wonderful location -- close to downtown shopping, Chinatown, and North Beach. If it wasn't for the steep hill it's at the top of, one could easily walk to and from many of San Francisco's sites (it's the walk back that will kill you). The hotel is housed in a former bank and is very stately looking. However, I do need to agree with a previous reviewer that it is showing wear. While our room was plenty roomy, the beds were not comfortable -- saggy mattresses. The air conditioner was ineffective -- the room got warm and stuffy at night. Our room was on the fourth floor and early morning traffic noise was a slight problem. However, the staff was very friendly and welcoming. They made some great recommendations for dinner. We had a very good rate and we certainly got our money's worth -- location alone was worth the price. Would we stay again? Maybe.

Reviews.Title: “Ritz San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: M M
Reviews.Content: GREAT EXPERIENCE! Rooms were nice size....bathrooms needed to be updated a little but still really nice! NEED I SAY MORE!

Reviews.Title: “Elegant hotel in the heart of San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: Joe H
Reviews.Content: This elegant old building is ideally situated for your stay in San Francisco. The rooms are comfortable and well-appointed, and the service is outstanding, with special mention of the concierge service. The health club and spa are spotlessly clean and of a generous size, with a great assortment of equipment. Great comfort and value

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: SwissSpaceBoy
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights in a club-level room on the 8th floor. Our overall opinion was not so excellent. Some good points : - good restaurant "The Dining Room" - club level with private elevator access, private concierge and food & drinks the whole day. - large room with large screen, dvd player, airco, coffee machine, Bulgari bath products - free internet if you are on the club level otherwise you have to pay. - good room service - well located close to Chinatown and Market Street Some less good points : - bed not so good due to old mattress - very loud noise if you have a room in the inner court. Don't know which machine is running 24h/24h but this is too noisy, even on the 8th floor. The other rooms could be on the street where you have traffic and/or cablecars. - remote control for dvd player was missing at arrival - minibar was broken at arrival but it was replaced the next day - very small safe in the closet - housekeeping good but could be better. They should also be less visible in the corridors. This IS a 5* hotel and not a B&B. - furniture is getting a bit old (curtains, carpet, ...). Everything seemed a bit outdated and it needs some freshening. If you can find a good price, this hotel is correct for a stay in SF. Not sure we will return however and for a first visit to Ritz-Carlton, we were not impressed.

Reviews.Title: “Good experience”
Reviews.Author: Nrock
Reviews.Content: My wife and three boys stayed here at the end of August. Our one bedroom suite was much larger than typical and the staff was great all the way around. We had some minor complaints, the furniture was pretty tired in the living room, the pullout couch was a full rather than a queen but nothing serious. The room did have a quirk, no windows in the bedroom. It was a good hub for exploring and walkable to many things, even with a 5 year old. I wouldn't recommend it for the young and cool but for a family of 5 it worked very well.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: gwcala
Reviews.Content: We travel to SF several times a year and this hotel has one of the best locations. We love the historic ambiance. But, it's time for a freshening, which I was told is forthcoming soon. Based on what this hotel has been, we are eager to see it's reincarnation.

Reviews.Title: “Great!”
Reviews.Author: WattsonB
Reviews.Content: Very friendly staff and helpful. Couldn't ask for better service

Reviews.Title: “Another lovely stay at the Ritz”
Reviews.Author: Grimhand
Reviews.Content: Spent two nights on the club level and loved it but what's not to love? As others have mentioned it's a great location, within walking distance of both Chinatown and Union Square; and a cable car ride away from Fisherman's Wharf. Valet is steep at 60-something so next time may try some of the parking tips mentioned in other reviews. Service was impeccable except for the plates and wine glasses left outside our door all day.

Reviews.Title: “Everything you expect and then some!”
Reviews.Author: Lou-Moni
Reviews.Content: The Ritz Carlton San Francisco was amazing from the moment you arrive. As we entered the building and stated our name, my wife was greeted with a "happy birthday" and a glass of champane....I had called weeks earler informing the Ritz it was a birthday weekend for my wife. I can't complement the service enough, it is top notch and the huge rooms are amazing. We usually do not stay in hotels this expensive but it was my wifes birthday, and we quickly realized, you get what you pay for!

Reviews.Title: “Had an excellent stay here”
Reviews.Author: travel141
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 days at the Ritz-Carlton in San Fran as part of a week-long trip in Northern CA. It's an excellent hotel. Our suite was well-appointed & comfortable with nice views. The food at the casual restaurant was delicious. And the location is great -- very central to most of the things we wanted to do. If I had to pick one tiny issue it would be that we weren't completely thrilled with some of the concierge's restaurant recommendations. We were traveling with my 7-year old daughter and frequently asked for family-friendly dining reco's, and some of the places they sent us to were a little off the mark (one was so casual it was basically a fast-food place, and another place was way too formal). But other than, absolutely no complaints with this hotel. I don't know if there was anything truly exceptional about it (as far as luxury properties go), but it definitely met or exceeded our expectations and we had a lovely time there.

Reviews.Title: “Best in Luxury San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: caro55
Reviews.Content: I have to say, I am puzzled that this establishment does not rank higher in the Trip Advisor review. Because our children and grandchildren live in San Francisco (with not a lot of room for extra family) we always stay here, usually for at least 3 consecutive nights. The staff is so warm and accommodating, even more so since we stay there frequently. One of the great advantages about this location is that they will deliver your car to you at the hotel. Believe me, what a relief not to have to go through the crazy hassle of picking up the car at the airport. Take a cab, and voila, your car is there. OK, that said, it is a little pricey to store your car there every night, so if you plan on staying in town for a couple of days, and then departing, order up your car the day you are leaving to continue your trip south. I should say that in all the times we have stayed here, we have never once had a problem.

Reviews.Title: “Good service but tired hotel”
Reviews.Author: workingjapan
Reviews.Content: Quality service was Ritz but Hotel is tired and old.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service, Concierge Level”
Reviews.Author: easthorizon
Reviews.Content: We arrived mid-afternoon after driving from Big Sur. Upon arrival at Nob Hill, under the porte-cochère, the Ritz Carlton experience began with professional attendants & security welcoming us and escorting our bags to reception. Very positive first impression! Reception & check-in were quick and informative. We had a suite on the Concierge level and it was worth it. Overlooking China Town and the Financial District, the room was large, a very large "L" shaped room with a double vanity marble bath. Very clean! The value proposition here is the complimentary breakfast, lunch, and dinner which are incredible, stylized spreads (including many healthy options) with drinks & desserts in the Concierge Lounge. The lounge is excellent, with comfortable & elegant seating, professional servers and views of the gardens below. We rarely dined out & never cracked open the mini-bar. The gym is first rate and required given the delicious and ample food. The guest relations on the Concierge level put forth every effort to accommodate our requests. When we arrived my husband needed a haircut and within 10 minutes we had an appointment with the nicest gentleman a few blocks away from the hotel. Our one evening that we did not have reservations for dinner, we were taken care of beautifully and driven by the hotel's chauffeur.

Reviews.Title: “Not Bad”
Reviews.Author: ho_sik
Reviews.Content: overall good city hotel. unfortunately gyn was under renovation and I was unaware of this. They did have an arrangement with a gym near by, but I did not bother with it. The hotel bathrooms need updating - size is good but the shower is not powerful enough. Best thing about the hotel is LOCATION. Paying corporate rate so good value for me.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel & close to everything”
Reviews.Author: kweaver22
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Ritz-Carlton, and I definitely plan on staying there when I am back in SF. It's very conveniently located -- Union Square was only a short walk away. The service and staff were wonderful even with some odd requests.

Reviews.Title: “Not the amazing place it used to be”
Reviews.Author: NCHKCA
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel 10 years ago, and had an incredible experience - all the good things we'd ever heard about the Ritz experience. The facility is the same great location and old European style (refreshed in 5 years ago), but the service has changed. The valet/bellman was efficient but not welcoming. No more staff these days to open the front doors and greet you. Dining area used for breakfast was too small and couldn't accommodate all the guests, and the staff seemed somewhat disorganized. Food remains very expensive ($24 for an omelette at breakfast). Internet is a separate charge, which doesn't seem like a luxury experience. I still give it 4 stars for the room and the location, which are both very good relative to other options in the city - but it's a low 4 stars relative to price and not meeting the expectation of service that the Ritz Carlton promises.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Staff, Beautiful Hotel, Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: sandyb39
Reviews.Content: I cannot say enough about the wonderful staff- especially the Concierge Team at the Club Level! They were so friendly and professional and were very helpful with any special requests. They helped with dinner reservations, car rental and itinerary information. The beverage/light meal presentation and quality was great and we found it to be very convenient and always looked forward to our return to the hotel and a fresh beverage. The gym was being remodeled and we visited the temporary gym which had spin bicycles and treadmills. Plenty of exercise with the SF hills as well! We found the hotel very conveniently located; we shopped in Chinatown and Union Square- walked down to the Ferry Building- took a pedicab over to Fishermans Wharf (overly crowded) and hiked it back up to the hotel because the trolley from FWharf was very crowded and had an hour wait time. One day we used a rental car to travel to Saratoga for a concert and we arranged it through the hotel -they have a special deal with Hertz and they delivered the car to the hotel which was an added convenience. We had considered other hotels but chose this primarily because of the hotel reputation and club level amenities. Would highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service Room, No good entrance nor spa or pool services”
Reviews.Author: slv2010
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent hotel, although it is important for them to make some reforms to keep in his position Cleaning service was no very good, we found dust in many places and almonds in the carpet, the carpet was no clean at all The tub in the bathroom was a bit old and a bit small The matresses of the beds were no good, I think they were quite old, same for pillows There was no pool working (they told us they were reforming it) The spa closes very soon which we don´t find it ok for this type of hotel category The shop at the hotel was very poor, so we could not find anything we needed The service in the hotel is excellent in general and the room service is really good. It makes you feel confortable and feeling welcomed really warmly The entrance to the hotel is not very good, cars arriving, cars living and people going in and out makes it a bit unconfortable and you feel not being very secure between all this cars

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel but make sure your room is not on the cable car side”
Reviews.Author: GatorRandy
Reviews.Content: This hotel is lovely but the noise from the cable cars was annoying. The spa and gym are being renovated so the exercise facility is minimal. Crackerjack concierge staff with a special shout out to David Hay.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel experience ever”
Reviews.Author: love_4_travel4ever
Reviews.Content: This hotel was fabulous, we were hear for a business conference and everyone in the hotel was so nice and accomodating. I had hurt my ankle and couldn't walk before coming here, they provided a wheel chair and crutches with no hesitation. Anything we requested was always provided with such enthusiasm, even the housekeeper got us ice and acted excited to do so. My expectations were more than met. The rooms are beautiful, I loved opening the windows to let the fresh air in. No need for air condition the weather is perfect. The bathroom amenities are exceptional, the lotion, qtips, cotton balls, mouth wash, etc. Very convenient location, plus if you are going somewhere close to the hotel they have a car service free, but make sure you tip the driver, they are super friendly.

Reviews.Title: “the best”
Reviews.Author: CAcowboy
Reviews.Content: The perfect hotel, even for families. The rooms are enormous, the staff is fabulous and the food in the dining room is worthy of more than one Michelin star. I can't say enough wonderful things about this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Entirely Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: HeatherSanDiego
Reviews.Content: We spent the weekend in two rooms here. The rooms were both decorated in the traditional Ritz Carlton style which I love. They were spacious, well appointed & had very comfortable beds. The mini bars were nicely stocked, as was the coffee machine in the room. I liked the bathrooms very much as they were elegant, had good light & spacious. Housekeeping was flawless. The bell desk at this hotel was uniformly cheerful & helpful - which I find rare in SF. We ate breakfast twice in the hotel. While expensive, it was delicious & I absolutely love the room in which it was served. It reminds me of an English country hotel. The waiters were well trained, cordial & professional - no complaints about anything at this property! One thing we did joke about was a rather somber & creepy portrait of two sad, brown haired children. We had to pass it repeatedly on the 4th floor & never failed to shudder at their spooky little faces. I can't wait to return to this property! Congratulations to the GM on a job well done! Thank you all for a great stay!

Reviews.Title: “This Hotel exceeds expectations!”
Reviews.Author: roper84
Reviews.Content: Very nice appointments. Great staff at every turn. Very friendly. Perfectly clean.

Reviews.Title: “Afternoon Tea at the Ritz-Carlton”
Reviews.Author: bbcbearuk
Reviews.Content: First of all, I wasn't staying at this hotel but was looking for somewhere in the city that did a decent British style afternoon tea. The RC does it on weekends only and really as a substitute for lunch. Seating times are from 1:00pm to 2:30pm depending on the day, so not suitable for a stopgap between lunch and dinner. I had made an online reservation and was expecting to be in the Dining Room but this was closed and tea was being served in the Lobby Lounge. A pleasant room with a few windows and a bar at one end. It is next to but separate from the Lobby proper which was a plus. The service was very very good. Frequent checking back and extra top-ups of food were available at no extra charge. I thought it was a little on the pricey side; I had the option including a glass of bubbly and it came to about $70 after tax and not including tip. Having said all this, I would have no hesitation in recommending this nor going back fo a repeat visit.

Reviews.Title: “Not what we expected”
Reviews.Author: catbluesky
Reviews.Content: The staff was pleasant, but the lounge and dining room service and food left much to be desired. I honestly could not believe that quality of the food served in one of, what I once considered, the top hotels in San Francisco. Disappointing. My friend and I booked a pedicure through the hotel spa and were shocked to be led to a hotel room with a big screen tv playing the hoarder show. I don't watch television as a rule and was appalled that a spa would have such a tacky presentation. The technicians were apologetic about their lack of nail colors and accommodations. As a plus, the hotel took the charges off the bill when we reported this spa disappointment.

Reviews.Title: “I love this hotel and it's staff”
Reviews.Author: DayDreamsRanch
Reviews.Content: This is the 2nd time we have stayed here. From the doormen (cute hats!) to the waitstaff the service is wonderful and accommodating.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Anniversary Stay”
Reviews.Author: crisy7777
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel about 200 pm. We were promptly escorted to the desk for check in. We were shown to our room by a very attentive bellman. We were celebrating our 29 th anniversary. The hotel knew about this through our travel agent. At 400 pm there was a knock at the door. They brought champagne,cookies and strawberries. It all arrives on the Golden Gate Bridge. It was unbelievable. That night we had rose petals sprinkled on the bed. Beautiful! The room was great. We were staying in Club level. It is extremely expensive but this was a special occasion. I loved everything about our stay. The food at the restaurant was exceptional. Loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic! Amazing hotel! Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: atronce
Reviews.Content: This is a stellar hotel, conveniently located close to Union Square, Chinatown, and North Beach. The room itself was beautifully furnished, exceptionally clean, and well-stocked. The service was exactly what you would expect from the Ritz; in a word, FANTASTIC! We will definitely return to this exceptional hotel!

Reviews.Title: “One of the Best!”
Reviews.Author: BelGal
Reviews.Content: I was really surprised to read some negative reviews of this hotel as we found it fantastic, I could live in this hotel! Staff was amazing, attentive and fast. Hotel was beautiful, room was divine (we got an upgrade) and room amenities perfect. With just a short walk to Union Square, the location was great. Room service food was above average and the breakfast buffet was good. The room price for a San Fran hotel I found to be comparable with others and the standard better than most. The only negatives would be the Wifi is not free (a definite must these days) and there is no parking (valet only and very expensive). But those points aside this is now the only hotel I will stay in when visiting San Fran in the future, would definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Experience”
Reviews.Author: Travelwithfamily05
Reviews.Content: Spent three nights here with my family. We wanted to be close to Napa Valley as well as close to all the main city attractions. It was everything you expect from a Ritz Carlton. Service was great, rooms were spacious and clean, and food was excellent. No complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Lackluster stay”
Reviews.Author: Atomicjay007
Reviews.Content: Despite having received a nice room upgrade upon check in, the rest of the stay was downhill. First off, when we arrived at the porte cochere to check the car with the valet, we were immediately approached by a bellhop, presumably to take our luggage and port our car to the garage. The bellhop had a different idea. Rather than assist my female companion with her luggage, he stood at the trunk of the car engaging her in a battle of wills to see who would ultimately extract the luggage (2 standard size suitcases). To her credit, she waited him out and he begrudgingly lifted the luggage out. I was wrestling with the duffle bags in the backseat while this exchange took place. We then were directed to the check in area where we were greeted by a friendly face. Our check in was handled professionally but unremarkably. There was no escort to our rooms. Nor were we offered any sort of refreshment at the front desk. I arrived at my room to find it in proper order. Average cleanliness and adequately maintained. The furniture showed its age (couch was worn in areas and chairs were slightly stained). The room contained a nicely stocked mini-fridge and Bvlgari toiletries (strongly scented and more feminine in smell). The pillows were just right, the mattress worn and covered with what I presume to be a bedwetting preventive cover which sounded and felt like a pamper. It crackled through the night and detracted from the sleep experience. My companion confirmed her mattress was similarly fitted with said pamper so I conclude all the beds have this deplorable feature. After check in, we decided to check out the spa for a massage. The spa facilities are small and the lockerroms more gym-like than spa-like. Massage rooms are average. We agreed to meet up in the pool/hottub area after the treatments. To my dismay, after receiving a relaxing massage, I exited the locker area to the wet area to be confronted with 5-6 children under the age of 5 screaming and running around. The children were attended to by a grand mother who yelled not less than 25 times "no running! Last warning!". The children did not heed warning and continued their misbehavior. Spa staff did not intervene and at least attempt to maintain a spa-like atmosphere. Our massages were shot and we decided to bail. The hotel should simply call this area the pool area/daycare for lazy parents. It is not a spa atmosphere in the least. There are no "adults only" wet areas in the hotel. We then had dinner at The Dining Room (the hotel restaurant). We each selected the chef's tasting menu. The food was outstanding; service was awkward with long delays between courses. The entire presentation took more than three hours. The length of service is less of a critique and more of a warning to plan your timing accordingly. I encountered several staff who were at all times friendly and professional but who lacked refinement. (not addressing me by name, no anticipation of needs, etc). The one exception to this criticism is who I believed to be the head bellman I encountered when checking out, who was outstanding. Overall my treatment during the stay was on par with a Hyatt or Marriott; entirely disappointing for the cost and expectations.

Reviews.Title: “So disappointed with this Ritz!”
Reviews.Author: MelissaBradley
Reviews.Content: Writing this review makes me sad; so I most likely won't go into all the details that I could. First let me start off by saying that we booked about 20 rooms here for our family, friends and ourselves and had our holiday party in the ballroom. We picked this location because I had a baby shower here in the past in the tea room and was very pleased with how well that went. However this event did not go well and the service was horrific. Let me start with the good, then I'll get into the bad and the down right ugly. The Good: This hotel is a historic building, I believe it was formerly a banking building or an insurance building back in the day and it has a lot of gorgeous restored details. That is why we thought it would be perfect for Christmas as it was so orante and decorative inside and out. It was decorated nicely for christmas with a tree and other garland. The bell man were all generally attentive with a few exceptions. The Bad and The Ugly: The rest of it was horrible. The staff did not remember our names most of the time even though we spent a fortune on the rooms and the party with catering. I could not believe how rude and snobby most of the staff was, especially the front desk and the catering department/ party planners. We also had rooms that offered us terrible views with lots of street noise. There are so many other 5 star hotels in San Francisco that offer amazing views. In fact many of our nearly 200 party goers stayed at other hotels within walking distance at half the price and raved of not only their amazing views but their outstanding service as well. I could go on and on here and probably should but I just can't because it makes me so sad. If it were just my family it would be a different story; but I was hosting a large group and was so terribly disappointed with everything. Even one of my guests had a cell phone, wallet and jacket stolen. Some people crashed our party. I know this for a fact because I saw two men in jeans in our lobby area just outside our ballroom. I asked them who they were with and they didn't have an answer. However they went into our rented room. There was no security in sight. Also, we were overcharged on several accounts but the most blaring was that we were charged for bottled water every time someone just asked for water. I was promised water from tap would be served unless specified. This might seem petty, but it's just a glimpse into the unprofessionalism I experienced all around. I also noticed that it looked like the same bottle of water was being used by a bartender. It was never freshly opened in front of the guests. This led me to believe that it was being refilled with tap water and then poured into a glass when a guest requested water. I would not say this unless I was pretty sure this is what was going on. For the record, I did have this portion of my bill adjusted. I know all of this sounds a little odd for me to observe this level of minutia, but I am a business owner myself and quite an obsessive person about the details. There were more disappointments with the food as well. I have notes form the whole ordeal but I don't feel like digging them up just now. I am writing this review mainly as a comparison to the Ritz Carlton Half Moon Bay. I gave that hotel five points. This one I am afraid gets one point from me and I believe that is the lowest score I have ever given a hotel. Also, to further my credibility for judgment ability I have owned a business for about 20 years and have hosted hundreds of parties at restaurants and hotels. In fact we generally host 2-5 parties at hotels and dozens at restaurants each year. This hotel was by far the worst experience ever; so many other details I just can't bare to rehash; which makes me so sad because we were hoping to give our guests such a memorable event. We ironically had picked the Ritz over hotels with better menus and better views because of it's world wide reputation for class and service. We had hosted an event at the Half Moon Bay Ritz property and had a 5 star experience there and expected the same in San Francisco. Unfortunately not all Ritz Carlton hotels uphold the reputation that they should. If you thought this review was helpful please let me know. Thank you and best of luck.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice - but dated”
Reviews.Author: globalsurf
Reviews.Content: The Ritz is very nice and certainly reminds one of times gone by. I stayed for business and will stay again in the future. Service is top notch. The experience is a bit dated - not a bad thing if that is what you seek! At the room prices charged internet should be free!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel”
Reviews.Author: JGMoore
Reviews.Content: Started off at the Fairmont, which was so abysmal that we checked out first thing in the morning and moved over to the Ritz. With only about 10 minutes notice (this was about 7 in the morning) they had our welcome envelope ready, bumped us up to the club level, and let us check in 4 hours early. Hotel doesn't have a great view, but aside from that it can't be beat. Such a contrast from the Fairmont!!

Reviews.Title: “Adorable Hotel in a adorable City”
Reviews.Author: euronautix
Reviews.Content: Staying in the Suite it was very fascinating to be there. The only thing, that wasn´t so good, was the Pool .... the water was very chlorinated.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect one night stop”
Reviews.Author: In-the-know88
Reviews.Content: From the greeting by superstar Elmer, to a pitch perfect recommendation for dinner from the concierge, this stay has been perfect. I have stayed here a lot of times as well as the Four Seasons, St Regis, and (ugh) the Westin. I think the Ritz has gotten a lot better in the past year- it has gone from great to a perfect stay. I do not like having to pay for internet though (my complaint for all hotels) Overall, nothing to complain about and even more, a lot to compliment and praise.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome for your super rich grandma”
Reviews.Author: Lyndseyrichard
Reviews.Content: Small room, stuffy, lame, smells and looks like your grandmas house. Nice pool and location.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Businees Stay”
Reviews.Author: awenzl
